basics.name: Thien Quy Pham
basics.summary: Currently employed at University of Pittsburgh. Ph.D. candidate in Biostatistics

publications.name: Unraveling the Mechanisms Behind the Short-Term Effects of Dry Needling: New Insights From a Mediation Analysis With Repeatedly Measured Mediators and Outcomes
publications.publisher: Archives of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation
publications.summary: This study explores the causal pathways through which deep dry needling (DDN) alleviates chronic neck pain, using a longitudinal mediation analysis of repeatedly measured mediators and outcomes.
